item.description: Hi, Please check the following changes in that code: - Delegate does not perform any access to VC. - Service was adjusted to break the dependency of delegate loaded physical data(Move and ValidateExport). - Power, Covered and Auxiliary validations does not access the VC when physical data is already loaded.
item.testing_done: Assign and Unassign (Covered, Auxiliary and Power) Export and Move: Target and Bay validations (Covered, Auxiliary and Power) I will describe the TP tests in QUIX.

item.description:
ACTUAL RESULT: VCEM returns the following message: "Invalid network connection port number. Port number must be bigger than 0.". Notice that the message says "network" instead of "iSCSI".
EXPECTED RESULT: VCEM should return"Invalid iSCSI connection port number. Port number must be bigger than 0."

item.summary: QXCR1001153089: Innacurate message creating a profile via SOAP without iSCSI port number

item.description:
4.1 Installer, Upgrade and Migrate
AS A/AN... VCEM User I WOULD LIKE TO... Install, Upgrade and Migrate VCEM 7.1 SO THAT... VCEM can add support for Bossier 3.5x firmware
4.2 Create Group
AS A/AN... VCEM User I WOULD LIKE TO... Create VC Domain Groups with VC Domains 3.5x or later SO THAT... VCEM can manage VC Domain 3.5x
4.4 Add To Group
AS A/AN... VCEM User I WOULD LIKE TO... Add VC Domains 3.5x or later to a VC Domain Group SO THAT... VC Domain Group can manage VC Domains 3.5x or later
4.5 Upgrade Group Fw Mode
AS A/AN... VCEM User I WOULD LIKE TO... Upgrade VC Domain Group to a FW Mode 3.5x or later SO THAT... Upgrade VC Domain Groups with FW Mode less than 3.5x or later
4.6 Import Server Profiles
AS A/AN... VCEM User I WOULD LIKE TO... Import Server Profiles with Extra Fabric Entries SO THAT... Manage Server Profiles created at VCM.
4.7 Copy Server Profiles
AS A/AN... VCEM User I WOULD LIKE TO... Copy Server Profiles with Extra Fabric Entries SO THAT... Duplicate Server Profiles with Extra Fabric Entries.
4.8 Extra Fabrics Enabled Features
AS A/AN... VCEM User I WOULD LIKE TO... Detect if the Extra Fabric Entries feature is enabled at a VC Domain SO THAT... VCEM can do Add to Group operations maintaining VC Domain and VC Domain Group with same Features
item.testing_done:
Verify if a VCEM 7.1 is correctly installed with a new table at VCEM database to store the FC Slices information. Verify if a VC Domain Group is created and match VCM Fc Slices information. Verify if a VC Domain 3.5x or later is added to a VC Domain Group 3.5x or later. Verify if a VC Domain 3.5x or later is added to a VC Domain Group with version less than 3.5x Verify if a VC Domain 3.5x or later is not added to a VC Domain Group with version less than 3.5x with extra FCoE connections Verify if a VC Domain Group is upgraded from a version less than 3.5x or later x to 3.5x or later with Fc Slices information. Verify if a Server Profile is imported with Extra Fabrics in a VC Domain Group 3.5x or later Verify if a Server Profile is copied with Extra Fabrics. Verify if a VC Domains with Extra Fabric Entries feature enabled is added to a group with this feature enabled for Extra FCoE Connections Verify if a VC Domain with Extra Fabric Entries feature disabled is not added to a group with this feature enabled
Verify if during Domain Maintenance a Fc Slices information is updated when a new module FCoE is added to an Enclosure. Verify if during Domain Maintenance a Fc Slices information is updated when a new module FCoE is removed from an Enclosure.
item.summary: Tiger Support - Partial

item.description: Hi, The Tunneled network validation in Export Profile was refactored. Please check that code was simplified in order to avoid loops in Source and Target networks list. The tunneled info of all target networtks is collected (in outer method) and passed to inner method in Map format(to allow easy retrieval). Thanks,

item.description: Changed boot validation to use isNill instead of !=null
item.testing_done: Exception in thread "main" AxisFault faultCode: {http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Server faultSubcode: faultString: Cannot perform server profile operation because: - The Initiator Name field is required for the iSCSI boot configuration. - The iSCSI Boot Settings cannot be empty when the iSCSI connection is configured as primary or secondary. Verify all the server profile information is correct and perform the operation again. faultActor: faultNode: faultDetail: {http://v6_3_1.api.mvcd.hp.com}MVCDException:<errorMessage>Cannot perform server profile operation because: - The Initiator Name field is required for the iSCSI boot configuration. - The iSCSI Boot Settings cannot be empty when the iSCSI connection is configured as primary or secondary. Verify all the server profile information is correct and perform the operation again.</errorMessage><keyCode>2649</keyCode><message>Cannot perform server profile operation because: - The Initiator Name field is required for the iSCSI boot configuration. - The iSCSI Boot Settings cannot be empty when the iSCSI connection is configured as primary or secondary. Verify all the server profile information is correct and perform the operation again.</message>

item.description: VCEM 7.1 is trying to retrieve Domain information through a SOAP API from a Enclosure that is not managed by any VC Domain Group. As the Enclosure there is not any Domain information a NullPointerException error is returned for SOAP users.

item.description: Hi, Please verify the code changes to ensure that Server Product Name is no longer gathered from ShowServers API (in getPhysicalInfo method). Instead, it should be retrieved from getVCBays API(in getServerInformation methods, there are 2 definitions for this method). I really appreciate your comments, Thanks,
item.testing_done: 1) Fetch the Server Information in Bay List page when VC Domain DD (running 3.30) and verify if single dense bays are returning the Server Product Name correctly (Unmanageable device should not be presented). 2) Fetch the Server Information in Profile Editor page when VC Domain DD (running 3.30) and verify if single dense bays are returning the Server Product Name correctly (Unmanageable device should not be presented). 3) Move server profile (same and another group) from a Single Dense bay to another bay (Single Dense or Double Dense) 4) Move server profile (same and another group) from a Double Dense bay to a Single Dense bay
item.summary: QXCR1001152788 - NullPointer exception when move profile from Single Dense Bay to DD Bay.

item.description:
This is a enhancement.
Customer is not able to complete maintenance because VCM returned an invalid base config XML and VCEM is returning an error message that does not tell the real problem.
So now we will detect if the base config is corrupted and throw a exception with the message below:
2049=The operation could not be performed because VCEM was unable to import the base configuration from VC Domain [{0}]. Verify VCEM can communicate with VC Manager and then perform the operation again.
The message already exist. Just reusing.
We are assuming that a healthy base config has a xml tag called "<hpvcd:ioSignature>", so we tested if this is inside the xml returned from VC.
OBS: It was NOT POSSIBLE TO REPRODUCE the problem, so the fix was tested using fake xml.
item.summary: QXCR1001143006 Improved error message may help diagnose VC problems
